definitions.definition: A small nonmilitary, non-nuclear submarine for exploration.
A retroactive term used for non-nuclear submarines; nuclear submarines are termed "true submarines".

A term used primarily by some navies for nuclear submarines, termed "true submersibles", because they cannot retroactively declare that their non-nuclear submarines should be called by a different name.
A very small "baby" submarine designed for specific localized missions, usually while tethered to a submarine or ship for life support and communications. Slang synonyms: midget-submarine, anchor.
An underwater vehicle with limited mobility, similar to a submarine, but less mobile.

main_definition: ( British ) A small nonmilitary, non-nuclear submarine for exploration.
secondary_definitions: ( British ) A retroactive term used for non-nuclear submarines; nuclear submarines are termed "true submarines".

( British ) A term used primarily by some navies for nuclear submarines, termed "true submersibles", because they cannot retroactively declare that their non-nuclear submarines should be called by a different name.

( US ) A very small "baby" submarine designed for specific localized missions, usually while tethered to a submarine or ship for life support and communications. Slang synonyms: midget-submarine, anchor.
( nautical ) An underwater vehicle with limited mobility, similar to a submarine, but less mobile.
